Posts.Content: jen29 wrote: I have my MRI in 12 hours and I can't relax.  I know it's just a metal tube, but I can't calm down.  Can anyone offer any advice???  I just want to scream!!! Log in to post a reply

Thanks for the hug and one great big (((((HUG))))) right back at ya!!! Love and prayers to all! jen
Posts.Title: 12 hours and soooo scared!!! jen29 jen29

Posts.Content: Oct 24, 2008 02:34AM jen29 wrote: Deb, Thank you for your thoughts.  Yes, this is my first one and I'm only 29.  I am a praying woman and thus I will take your advice to pray, pray, and pray some more.  I just can't seem to breath right now.  I am so scared that I'm so young and going through this.  I'm just sitting up right now and crying.  I don't know what to do.  I'm scared!!!  I'm sooooo scared.  I'm too young to go through this!  I keep thinking about my life.  I just went through a divorce from an abusive alcoholic a year ago and now this.  What did I do wrong to get this crap now?????  Heaven help me!  I need help!!!   Lord, please wrap your arms around me with love and support.  I need to feel your love and comfort! me
Posts.Title: 12 hours and soooo scared!!! jen29 jen29

Posts.Content: Oct 24, 2008 07:27AM jen29 wrote: Good golly...you ladies are soooooo wonerful.  It might be 4:30am and I still haven't slept a wink and I have my appt in 6 hours, but I'm starting to calm down.  I have to thank you all for your thoughts.  I like the idea of asking the tech to keep talking to me.  I think that might help.  I also have a great CD picked out to be listening to before the machine starts.  Maybe since I'm still awake at this point it might just put me to sleep in the machine.  Thank you ladies.  You are ALL a blessing from God!!!  Family is great, but you can only vent so much to them before they get tired of hearing it and you feel like they're blocking you out.  Whatever would I do without you?!?  Good thing I don't have to experience that!  I feel the hugs and the love coming through my laptop.  Thanks! Time for another bunch of deep breaths, huh?  I will let you all know when I get home and when I have emerged from the metal tube =) Great big hugs, jen
Posts.Title: 12 hours and soooo scared!!! jen29 jen29

Posts.Content: Oct 24, 2008 07:20PM jen29 wrote: Hey ladies - I survived!!!  I took all of your advice, prayed, breathed, and I made it.  I didn't use the wash cloth over the eyes because that is a little too constricting for me (I need to feel fresh air).  Thank you all so much!!!  Side note:  Jule you mentioned the WA ladies.  How do i find them on here?  Deb you mentioned to private message you.  How do I do that? I MADE IT!!!  MRI down...biopsy next week. Hugs, jen
Posts.Title: 12 hours and soooo scared!!! jen29 jen29

Posts.Content: Oct 24, 2008 09:24AM jen29 wrote: Sheila - That is one of my favorite verses!!!  I know that He is there for me and all night I've been talking with Him.  Geez I'm glad He's such a great listener =)  just like all of you!  Trying to catch my breath and continuing to pray, jen

Posts.Content: jen29 wrote: Hey, this is my first post so please excuse my random thoughts.  I'm 29 with a family history of breast cancer and i just went in for a base line mamo.  They found a calcification in my left breast and I'm scheduled for an MRI & also a biopsy.  I have talked with my parents about this, but I feel like I can't be 100% real.  My dad doesn't do well with illness (especially not with his "little girl").  I'm just scared.  I know that it's good that they found this abnormality early, but that doesn't take my fear away.   Does anyone out there have any advice or suggestions??? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: I'm 29 and I'm really scared!!! jen29 wondering7

Posts.Content: Oct 20, 2008 09:39PM jen29 wrote: Leaf - You're amazing!  Thank you for the support and thoughts.  I understand about doing things i hate.  I've been pretty good at that :)  Let me tell you that my house is SPOTLESS!!!  I've read all the research that says that most biopsies are benign, but that really doesn't help much.  My mom had a double mast. two years ago.  But I'm single, I'm dating, I'm starting a new job, and I really can't have these distractions.  Why now?  Why is this crap happening?  I feel so alone.  My parents would be here with me every day if I asked, but I guess I keep telling myself that I need to do it on my own.  Then I feel alone again.  What a freakin' roller coaster!  Need some hugs from someone who's been through this...
Posts.Title: I'm 29 and I'm really scared!!! jen29 wondering7

Posts.Content: Oct 21, 2008 10:33PM jen29 wrote: Kimber, You are such a dear!  I'm so happy I found this site and I have all of you supporting me.  I really don't think I would be doing as well if it weren't for you!!!  Thank you to everyone.  2 days and I deal with my claustrophobia in a large metal tube.  Fun fun!  Time to get busy.  There is always more house to clean and organizing to do :) jen
